newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Pearl Oriental raises stake in hotel.
newsitem.headline: Pearl Oriental raises stake in hotel.

text.p: Hong Kong's Pearl Oriental Holdings Ltd said on Friday it planned to raise its stake in the Pearl Island Hotel to 65 percent from 30 percent for HK$115.53 million.

The company said HK$30 million of the purchase would be paid for in cash and the balance through the issue of 31.10 million new shares, or 0.666 percent of the expanded share capital, at HK$2.75 each.
It said the additional 35 percent stake in the hotel was bought from a third party Hing Fat Holdings Ltd.
Chesterton Petty Ltd has valued the 320 room hotel at HK$1.35 billion. The hotel, located in Hong Kong's Central business district, is under construction and due to open its doors in 1997.

"The group views the hotel and torusim industry in Hong Kong with optimism and hence increases their equity investment in the hotel sector," said the company's chairman Wong Kwan in a statement. "The purchase will enlarge the net asset value of the company."
Shares of Pearl Oriental ended at HK$2.775 on Thursday.
